auth_config.name: api_token
auth_config.label: Postmark API Token
auth_config.message: This API key will be used for accessing Postmark service.

From.text: The sender email address. Must have a registered and confirmed Sender Signature.To include a name use the format "Full Name <sender@domain.com>" for the address.

To.text: Recipient email address.Multiple addresses are comma separated.Max 50.

Cc.text: Cc recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.

Bcc.text:
Bcc recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.
Subject

Tag.text: Email tag that allows you to categorize outgoing emails and get detailed statistics.

HtmlBody.text: If no TextBody specified HTML email message

TextBody.text: If no HtmlBody specified Plain text email message

ReplyTo.text: Reply To override email address.Defaults to the Reply To set in the sender signature. Multiple addresses are comma separated.

Headers.text: List of custom headers to include.

TrackOpens.text: Activate open tracking for this email.

TrackLinks.text: Activate link tracking for links in the HTML or Text bodies of this email.Possible options; None HtmlAndText HtmlOnly TextOnly

MessageStream.text: Set message stream ID that's used for sending.If not provided message will default to the "outbound" transactional stream.

From.text: The sender email address. Must have a registered and confirmed Sender Signature. To include a name, use the format "Full Name <sender@domain.com>". Punctuation in the name would need to be escaped.

To.text: Recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.

Cc.text: Cc recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.

Bcc.text: Bcc recipient email address. Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50.

Tag.text: Email tag that allows you to categorize outgoing emails and get detailed statistics.

HtmlBody.text: If no TextBody specified HTML email message

TextBody.text: If no HtmlBody specified Plain text email message

ReplyTo.text: Reply To override email address. Defaults to the Reply To set in the sender signature.

Headers.text: List of custom headers to include.

TrackOpens.text: Activate open tracking for this email.

TrackLinks.text: Activate link tracking for links in the HTML or Text bodies of this email. Possible options: None HtmlAndText HtmlOnly TextOnly

MessageStream.text: Set message stream ID that's used for sending.If not provided message will default to the "outbound" transactional stream.

count.text: Number of messages to return per request. Max 500.Count + Offset cannot exceed 10000 messages

offset.text: Number of messages to skip.Count + Offset cannot exceed 10000 messages

recipient.text: Filter by the user who was receiving the email

fromemail.text: Filter by the sender email address

status.text: Filter by status (queued or sent / processed).Note that sent and processed will return the same results and can be used interchangeably

todate.text: Filter messages up to the date/time specified (inclusive). e.g. 2021-01-01T12

fromdate.text: Filter messages starting from the date/time specified (inclusive)e.g. 2021-01-01T12

messagestream.text: Filter by message stream ID.If not provided message will default to the 'outbound' transactional stream

metadata_.text: Filter by metadata value e.g. metadata_color.

count.text: Number of bounces to return per request.Max 500.Count + Offset cannot exceed 10000 bounces.

offset.text: Number of bounces to skip. Count + Offset cannot exceed 10,000 bounces.

inactive.text: Filter by emails that were deactivated by Postmark due to the bounce.Set to true or false. If this isn’t specified it will return both active and inactive.

fromdate.text: Filter messages starting from the date/time specified (inclusive) e.g. 2021-01-01T12

todate.text: Filter messages up to the date/time specified (inclusive) e.g. 2021-01-01T12

messagestream.text: Filter by message stream ID. If not provided message will default to the outbound transactional stream.

count.text: Number of records to return per request.Max 500

ReturnPathDomain.text: A custom value for the Return-Path domain.It is an optional field but it must be a subdomain of your From Email domain and must have a CNAME record that points to pm.mtasv.net. For more information about this field please read our support page.
A custom value for the Return-Path domain.It is an optional field but it must be a subdomain of your From Email domain and must have a CNAME record that points to pm.mtasv.net.

count.text: Number of records to return per request

Rule.text: Email address (or domain) that you would like to block from sending.

MessageStreamType.text: Filters message streams based on stream type.Possible options; All Inbound Transactional Broadcasts.Defaults to All

IncludeArchivedStreams.text: Boolean filter for including archived message streams in list.Defaults to False.

SubscriptionManagementConfiguration.text: Subscription management options for the Stream

UnsubscribeHandlingType.text: The unsubscribe management option for the stream.For transactional streams default is None For broadcast streams default is Postmark. Unsubscribe management is required for broadcast message streams approved accounts can use Custom.Possible options

ID.text: The ID of the message stream being created.This is used when sending messages to specify the sending message stream

Name.text: The name of the message stream

Description.text: A description of the message stream
Description.examples: This is my second transactional stream

MessageStreamType.text: The type of message stream being created. Possible options Broadcasts Transasctional

SubscriptionManagementConfiguration.text: Subscription management options for the Stream

UnsubscribeHandlingType.text: The unsubscribe management option for the stream.For transactional streams default is None.For broadcast streams default is Postmark.Unsubscribe management is required for broadcast message streams approved accounts can use Custom.Possible options; none Postmark Custom.

count.text: Number of messages to return per request.Max 500.Count + Offset cannot exceed 10000 messages

offset.text: Number of messages to skip.Count + Offset cannot exceed 10000 messages

recipient.text: Filter by the user who was receiving the email

fromemail.text: Filter by the sender email address

status.text: Filter by status (blocked processed  queued failed scheduled)

todate.text: Filter messages up to the date specified (inclusive).e.g. 2021-01-01T12

fromdate.text: Filter messages starting from the date specified (inclusive).e.g. 2021-01-01T12

postmark__/messages/inbound/messageid/by.text: Bypass rules for a blocked inbound message

meta.description: Bypass rules for a blocked inbound message

postmark__/messages/inbound/messageid/re.text: Retry a failed inbound message for processing

meta.description: Retry a failed inbound message for processing

count.text: Number of messages to return per request.Max 500.Count + Offset cannot exceed 10000 messages

offset.text: Number of messages to skip.Count + Offset cannot exceed 10000 messages

messagestream.text: Filter by message stream ID.If not provided search will default to the outbound transactional stream

client_name.text: Filter by client name i.e.Outlook Gmail

client_company.text: Filter by company i.e.Microsoft Apple Google

client_family.text: Filter by client family i.e.OS X Chrome

os_name.text: Filter by full OS name and specific version i.e. OS X 10.9 Mavericks Windows 7

os_family.text: Filter by kind of OS used without specific version i.e. OS X Windows

os_company.text: Filter by company which produced the OS i.e. Apple Computer Inc.Microsoft Corporation

platform.text: Filter by platform i.e. webmail desktop mobile

country.text: Filter by country messages were opened in i.e.Denmark Russia

region.text: Filter by full name of region messages were opened in i.e.Moscow New York

city.text: Filter by full name of city messages were opened in i.e.Minneapolis Philadelphia

count.text: Number of message opens to return per request. Max 500
Number of message clicks to return per request Max 500

country.text: Filter by country messages were clicked in i.e. Denmark Russia

FromEmail.text: From email associated with sender signature

Name.text: From name associated with sender signature

ReturnPathDomain.text: A custom value for the Return-Path domain.It is an optional field but it must be a subdomain of your From Email domain and must have a CNAME record that points to pm.mtasv.net

Name.text: From name associated with sender signature

ReturnPathDomain.text: A custom value for the Return-Path domain.It is an optional field but it must be a subdomain of your From Email domain and must have a CNAME record that points to pm.mtasv.net.For more information about this field please read our support page

ConfirmationPersonalNote.text: A way to provide a note to the recipient of the confirmation email to have context of what Postmark is.Max length of 400 characters.
ConfirmationPersonalNote.examples: This is a note visible to the recipient to provide context of what Postmark is.

Color.text: Color of the server in the rack screen.Purple Blue Turquoise Green Red Yellow Grey Orange

RawEmailEnabled.text: When enabled the raw email content will be included with inbound webhook payloads under the RawEmail key

DeliveryHookUrl.text: URL to POST to every time email is delivered

SmtpApiActivated.text: Specifies whether or not SMTP is enabled on this server

InboundHookUrl.text: URL to POST to every time an inbound event occurs

BounceHookUrl.text: URL to POST to every time a bounce event occurs

OpenHookUrl.text: URL to POST to every time an open event occurs

PostFirstOpenOnly.text:
If set to true only the first open by a particular recipient will initiate the open webhook.Any subsequent opens of the same email by the same recipient will not initiate the webhook.
TrackOpens

TrackLinks.text: Indicates if all emails being sent through this server should have link tracking enabled for links in their HTML or Text bodies.Possible options;None HtmlAndText HtmlOnly TextOnly

ClickHookUrl.text: URL to POST to when a unique click event occurs

InboundSpamThreshold.text: The maximum spam score for an inbound message before it's blocked

EnableSmtpApiErrorHooks.text: Specifies whether or not SMTP API Errors will be included with bounce webhooks.

Color.text: Color of the server in the server list for quick identification.Purple Blue Turquoise Green Red Yellow Grey Orange

SmtpApiActivated.text: Specifies whether or not SMTP is enabled on this server

RawEmailEnabled.text: When enabled the raw email content will be included with inbound webhook payloads under the RawEmail key

DeliveryType.text: Specifies the type of environment for your server.Possible options; Live Sandbox.Defaults to Live if not specified.This cannot be changed after the server has been created

InboundHookUrl.text: URL to POST to every time an inbound event occurs

PostFirstOpenOnly.text: If set to true only the first open by a particular recipient will initiate the open webhook.Any subsequent opens of the same email by the same recipient will not initiate the webhook

InboundSpamThreshold.text: The maximum spam score for an inbound message before it's blocked

TrackOpens.text: Indicates if all emails being sent through this server have open tracking enabled

TrackLinks.text: Indicates if all emails being sent through this server should have link tracking enabled for links in their HTML or Text bodies.Possible options; None HtmlAndText HtmlOnly TextOnly

EnableSmtpApiErrorHooks.text: Specifies whether or not SMTP API Errors will be included with bounce webhooks.

messagestream.text: Filter by message stream.If not provided the response will include stats for all streams in the server.

SuppressionReason.text: Filter by suppression reason. Possible options; HardBounce SpamComplaint ManualSuppression

Origin.text: Filter by origin of how the address was added to suppression list. Possible options; Recipient Customer Admin

todate.text: Filter suppressions up to the date specified (inclusive) e.g. 2020-02-01

fromdate.text: Filter suppressions up to the date specified (inclusive) e.g. 2020-02-01

Suppressions.text: An ​array that will contain that email addresses to create a suppression on.Max of 50 suppressions that can be created in one call

EmailAddress.text: The email address to request suppression creation on.

Suppressions.text: An ​array of email addresses to delete a suppression on.Max of 50 suppressions that can be removed in one call

EmailAddress.text: The email address to request suppression deletion on.

TemplateId.text: The template to use when sending this message.Required if TemplateAlias is not specified

TemplateAlias.text: The alias of a template to use when sending this message.Required if TemplateId is not specified

TemplateModel.text: The model to be applied to the specified template to generate HtmlBody TextBody and Subject

InlineCss.text: By default, if the specified template contains an HTMLBody, we will apply the style blocks as inline attributes to the rendered HTML content. You may opt-out of this behavior by passing false for this request field.

From.text: The sender email address. Must have a registered and confirmed Sender Signature. To include a name use the format "Full Name <sender@domain.com>" for the address

To.text: Recipient email address.Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50

Cc.text: Cc recipient email address.Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50

Bcc.text: Bcc recipient email address.Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50

Tag.text: Email tag that allows you to categorize outgoing emails and get detailed statistics

ReplyTo.text: Reply To override email address.Defaults to the Reply To set in the sender signature

Headers.text: List of custom headers to include

TrackOpens.text: Activate open tracking for this email

TrackLinks.text: Activate link tracking for links in the HTML or Text bodies of this email.Possible options; None HtmlAndText HtmlOnly TextOnly

MessageStream.text: Set message stream ID that's used for sending. If not provided message will default to the outbound transactional stream

Messages.text: The list of templates to send.Please note that we accept up to 500 messages per API call

TemplateAlias.text: The template to use for this message.This value is required if TemplateId is not supplied.If both are supplied TemplateId will be used to select the template

TemplateId.text: The template to use for this message.This value is required if TemplateAlias is not supplied.If both are supplied TemplateId will be used to select the template

From.text: The sender email address.Must have a registered and confirmed Sender Signature. To include a name use the format "Full Name <sender@domain.com>" for the address

To.text: Recipient email address.Multiple addresses are comma separated. Max 50

Cc.text: Cc recipient email address.Multiple addresses are comma separated.Max 50

Bcc.text: Bcc recipient email address.Multiple addresses are comma separated.Max 50

Tag.text: Email tag that allows you to categorize outgoing emails and get detailed statistics

ReplyTo.text: Reply To override email address.Defaults to the Reply To set in the sender signature

Headers.text: List of custom headers to include

TrackOpens.text: Activate open tracking for this email.

TrackLinks.text: Activate link tracking for links in the HTML or Text bodies of this email.Possible options

MessageStream.text: Set message stream ID that's used for sending.If not provided message will default to the outbound transactional stream.

SourceServerID.text: Server ID of the source server containing the templates that will be pushed

DestinationServerID.text: Server ID of the destination server receiving the pushed templates

PerformChanges.text: Specifies whether to push templates to destination server or not. This parameter can be set to false to allow you to do a "dry-run" of the push operation so that you can see which templates would be created or updated from this operation.

Alias.text: An optional string you can provide to identify this template (if creating a standard template).Allowed characters are numbers ASCII letters and ‘.’ ‘-’ ‘_’ characters and the string has to start with a letter

HtmlBody.text: The content to use for the HtmlBody when this template is used to send email.Required if TextBody is not specified.See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field.A content placeholder is required to be present for a layout template and can be placed only once in the HtmlBody

TextBody.text: The content to use for the TextBody when this template is used to send email. Required if HtmlBody is not specified. See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field.A content placeholder is required to be present for a layout template and can be placed only once in the TextBody

Subject.text: The content to use for the Subject when this template is used to send email.Subject is only required on standard templates.See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field.Subjects are not allowed for layout templates and will result in an API error

TemplateType.text: Available when creating a template.To set if a template is standard template or layout template.Possible options; Standard or Layout.Defaults to Standard.After creation it's not possible to change a template type

LayoutTemplate.text: An optional string to specify which Layout Template to use (via layout alias) for an existing Layout Template when creating a standard template Allowed characters are numbers ASCII letters and ‘.’ ‘-’ ‘_’ characters and the string has to start with a letter.The API will throw an error if LayoutTemplate is present and the template type is a Layout.This field can also be set to null by using an empty string "".

Subject.text: The content to use for the Subject when this template is used to send email. See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field.

HtmlBody.text: The content to use for the HtmlBody when this template is used to send email.Required if TextBody is not specified.See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field

TextBody.text: The content to use for the TextBody when this template is used to send email. Required if HtmlBody is not specified. See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field

Alias.text: An optional string you can provide to identify this Template.Allowed characters are numbers ASCII letters and ‘.’ ‘-’ ‘_’ characters and the string has to start with a letter

LayoutTemplate.text: An optional string to specify which Layout Template to use (via layout alias) for an existing Layout Template when creating a standard template.Allowed characters are numbers ASCII letters and ‘.’ ‘-’ ‘_’ characters and the string has to start with a letter.The API will throw an error if LayoutTemplate is present and the template type is a Layout. This field can also be set to null by using an empty string "".

Count.text: The number of templates to return

Offset.text: The number of templates to "skip" before returning results

TemplateType.text: Filters templates based on template type (layout template or standard template).Possible options; All Standard Layout.Defaults to All

Subject.text: The subject content to validate.Must be specified if HtmlBody or TextBody are not.See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field

HtmlBody.text: The HTML body content to validate.Must be specified if TextBody or Subject are not.See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field.A content placeholder is required to be present to validate a layout template and can be placed only once in the HtmlBody

TextBody.text: The plain text body content to validate.Must be specified if Subject or HtmlBody are not.See our template language documentation for more information on the syntax for this field.A content placeholder is required to be present to validate a layout template and can be placed only once in the TextBody

TestRenderModel.text: The template model to be used when rendering test content

InlineCssForHtmlTestRender.text: When HtmlBody is specified the test render will have style blocks inlined as style attributes on matching html elements.You may disable the css inlining behavior by passing false for this parameter

TemplateType.text: Validates templates based on template type (layout template or standard template).Possible options; Standard or Layout.Defaults to Standard

LayoutTemplate.text: An optional string to specify which layout template alias to use to validate a standard template.If not provided a standard template will not use a layout template.

MessageStream.text: Filter by message stream.If no stream is provided will return all webhooks for the server. If a non existing stream is provided an error is thrown instead of an empty webhooks array.
The stream this webhook is associated with. If no MessageStream is provided the default transactional stream outbound will be used

Triggers.text: List of different webhooks events to enable

Open.text: Listing for if the Open webhook is enabled/disabled.Webhook will only post on first open if PostFirstOpenOnly is enabled

Click.text: Listing for if the Click webhook is enabled/disabled

Delivery.text: Listing for if the Delivery webhook is enabled/disabled

Bounce.text: Listing for if the Bounce webhook is enabled/disabled.Webhook will send full bounce content if IncludeContent is enabled

SpamComplaint.text: Listing for if the Spam webhook is enabled/disabled.Webhook will send full spam content if IncludeContent is enabled

SubscriptionChange.text: Listing for if the Subscription Change webhook is enabled/disabled.

HttpAuth.text: Optional.Add new Custom HTTP Auth username/password pairs

HttpHeaders.text: Add new Custom HTTP Headers name/value pairs

Triggers.text: List of different webhooks events to enable/disable. If only click is provided the other events will not changed. If no triggers are provided there’ll be no change

Open.text: Listing for if the Open webhook is enabled/disabled. Webhook will only post on first open if PostFirstOpenOnly is enabled

Click.text: Listing for if the Click webhook is enabled/disabled

Delivery.text: Listing for if the Delivery webhook is enabled/disabled

Bounce.text: Listing for if the Bounce webhook is enabled/disabled. Webhook will send full bounce content if IncludeContent is enabled

SpamComplaint.text: Listing for if the Spam webhook is enabled/disabled. Webhook will send full spam content if IncludeContent is enabled

SubscriptionChange.text: Listing for if the Subscription Change webhook is enabled/disabled.
